availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Robert B. Jameson (Beattyville, Owsley County, Kentucky, merchant and soldier)

body.p: Beattyville, Owsley County, Kentucky, merchant and soldier. Kentucky native. Married to Gilly Ann Jameson. Father of George Ella Jameson, Wlaker Jameson and Bronlow Jameson. Merchant in Owsley County in 1860. Owned one enslaved person in Owsley County in 1860. Served as a captain in 8th Kentucky Infantry (U.S.A) from January 15th, 1862, to March 17th, 1863.

ab.bibl:
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Owsley County, Beatyville, p. 376.

Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Lee County, Proctor, p. 335B.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Owsley County, Beatyville, 178B.
Report of the Adjutant General of the State of Kentucky, vol. 1, 1861-1866 (Frankfort: Kentucky Yeoman Office, 1866), 770.
